title: Spellbound Concerto record
brief_description: Though the theremin is most commonly associated with science fiction, it was first used in Alfred Hitchcock’s Spellbound (1945). For a dream sequence designed by Surrealist artist Salvador Dali, composer Miklós Rózsa used the theremin’s strange reverberations to produce unease and psychological tension.
